faq.heading: Common Questions About Our Services
faq.description: Find answers to the most common questions about our regenerative medicine treatments, international patient services, and clinic procedures.

items.question1: What types of regenerative medicine treatments do you offer?
items.answer1: We offer Platelet-Rich Plasma (PRP) therapy and autologous adipose-derived stem cell therapy. These evidence-based treatments harness your body's natural healing capabilities to address joint pain, sports injuries, and chronic musculoskeletal conditions without surgery. All treatments are performed by JOA-certified orthopedic specialists and adhere to Japanese medical laws and ethical standards.
items.question2: How do I know if I'm a candidate for regenerative medicine?
items.answer2: Eligibility is determined on a case-by-case basis following a thorough medical evaluation by our physicians. We review your medical history, imaging studies, and current symptoms during a remote consultation. Common candidates include those with knee osteoarthritis, sports injuries, shoulder and hip pain, and spine conditions. We provide preliminary suitability screening before you travel to Tokyo.
items.question3: What is the cost of treatment and what does it include?
items.answer3: Our treatment packages range from $25,000~ for a single session to $200,000~ for an annual care program. Single sessions include consultation, treatment, and 1-month follow-up. Three-session packages include personalized treatment plans and 3-month follow-up. Annual programs include unlimited treatments and dedicated concierge service. All prices are estimates and final costs depend on individual treatment requirements.
items.question4: How long does the treatment process take?
items.answer4: The complete process typically takes 3-5 days in Tokyo. Day 1: Initial consultation and evaluation. Day 2: Treatment day (PRP or stem cell therapy). Days 3-5: Recovery and follow-up instructions. We provide detailed pre- and post-procedure instructions, and arrange telemedicine follow-ups once you return home. Travel planning support is included for international patients.
items.question5: Is regenerative medicine safe and what are the risks?
items.answer5: Yes, our treatments are very safe when performed by qualified specialists. All procedures are performed by JOA-certified orthopedic surgeons in our state-of-the-art facility. We use your own cells (autologous), eliminating rejection risks. Potential side effects are minimal and typically include mild discomfort, swelling, or bruising at the injection site. We provide comprehensive pre-treatment screening to ensure safety.
items.question6: Do you provide support for international patients?
items.answer6: Yes, we offer comprehensive international patient services including visa letters (if needed), hotel recommendations, airport transfers, and multilingual support. Our English-speaking coordinators ensure smooth communication throughout your stay. We provide travel planning assistance and can arrange accommodations in Tokyo's premium Azabudai Hills district, just 20 minutes from Haneda Airport.
items.question7: What makes Rakan Clinic different from other medical facilities?
items.answer7: We combine 35+ years of JOA-certified orthopedic expertise with cutting-edge regenerative medicine research. Our team includes University of Tokyo professors and leading researchers in osteoimmunology. We offer state-of-the-art in-house laboratory facilities, private consultation rooms for VIP patients, and a unique blend of Western orthopedics with Eastern medicine approaches. Our Azabudai Hills location provides premium, discreet care for elite clientele.
items.question8: How long does it take to see results from treatment?
items.answer8: Results vary by individual and condition, but many patients report initial improvements within 2-4 weeks. Full benefits typically develop over 3-6 months as the regenerative process continues. We provide detailed recovery timelines and regular follow-up care to monitor progress. Our telemedicine follow-up system ensures continued support after you return home, with progress tracking and adjustment recommendations as needed.

facilities.heading: Cell Processing Center (CPC)
facilities.description: Our in-house CPC ensures maximum cell freshness, safety, and treatment effectiveness through pharmaceutical-grade sterile processing.

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.paragraph1: To maximize the effectiveness of stem cell treatment, our clinic has established a Cell Processing Center (CPC) within our medical facility.
introduction.paragraph2: We are committed to delivering highly fresh and high-quality stem cells to patients in the best possible condition.

cpc.title: What is CPC?
cpc.description: CPC (Cell Processing Center: 細胞培養加工室) is a specialized facility for processing and culturing cells used in regenerative medicine and cell therapy, ensuring a sterile and clean environment.
features: Managed under strict standards equivalent to pharmaceutical manufacturing
High cleanliness due to cleanroom structure
24-hour quality control system by dedicated culture specialists

quality.title: Quality Appeal of Stem Cells
quality.description: Our self-fat-derived stem cells maintain a survival rate of over 95%. Under a microscope, they appear healthy, uniform, and spindle-shaped — a crucial sign of their good condition.
features: Maintaining a uniform and beautiful form
Retaining proliferative capacity and differentiation potential
Being delivered in a fresh state at the time of administration
Directly contributing to the stability and safety of clinical effects

equipment.title: Latest Equipment to Protect Stem Cells

safetyCabinet.title: Biological Safety Cabinet
safetyCabinet.description: A device for aseptic operations. It protects cells and specimens aseptically, while also protecting operators and the environment from biohazards. It ensures a thoroughly clean space with HEPA filters and UV sterilization.

co2Incubator.title: CO2 Incubator
co2Incubator.description: Constantly maintains the temperature, humidity, and CO2 concentration essential for stem cell culture. Enables stable proliferation of cells in an optimal environment.

microscope.title: Inverted Microscope
microscope.description: A microscope that allows observation of living cells directly in their culture vessels. It continuously confirms cell morphology and growth processes, always grasping their healthy state.

passBox.title: Pass Box
passBox.description: A system used for transferring items between clean rooms or sterile rooms and the outside environment. With an interlock function that prevents both doors from opening simultaneously, thereby maintaining constant cleanliness and airtightness.

centrifuge.title: Centrifuge
centrifuge.description: Essential for cell separation and processing. Ensures precise handling of cell samples with controlled centrifugal force for optimal cell quality and viability.

items.title: High Cell Survival Rate (95% or more)
items.description: Cultivation starts immediately after fat collection to minimize damage.

items.title: Long-term Preservation with Liquid Nitrogen (-196°C)
items.description: Preserved in a semi-permanently usable state, can be administered at the necessary timing.

items.title: Administered in a Highly Fresh State
items.description: After cultivation, it is quickly administered intravenously to maximize regenerative power.

items.title: Passage Limit (up to 4 times)
items.description: Prevents aging and risks due to excessive cell division, ensuring safety.

items.title: Culture Specialists Permanently Stationed at CPC
items.description: Experienced cultivation specialists constantly monitor and manage cells, protecting quality.

conclusion.title: Conclusion
conclusion.paragraph1: We are thoroughly committed to the "quality" and "safety" of stem cell treatment. Our in-house CPC and state-of-the-art equipment, along with a management system by experienced cultivation specialists.
conclusion.paragraph2: All of these form the foundation for patients to receive treatment with peace of mind. We will continue to deliver the highest standard of stem cell treatment.
